item.title: Seeking Alpha From Market Participants' Information Acquisition Actions
item.description: Motivation Just like the trading imbalance could be a powerful signal for upcoming stock price movement, investors’ information acquisition actions are also indicative for future security returns. According to Lee and So (2015), acquiring information is costly for investors and thus they only do so when the expected profits can cover the relative costs. Ceteris paribus, securities which attract more investor attention may have a higher likelihood of experiencing abnormal stock volatility from which a sophisticated investor can cultivate Alphas.
